description: Text to speech module for Windows to speak messages and optionally play sounds

start_sound_path.description: Full path to a C(.wav) file containing a sound to play before the text is spoken.  Useful on conference calls to alert other speakers that ansible has something to say.

msg_file.description: Full path to a windows format text file containing the text to be spokend.  Use either msg or msg_file.  Optional so that you can use this module just to play sounds.

end_sound_path.description: Full path to a C(.wav) file containing a sound to play after the text has been spoken.  Useful on conference calls to alert other speakers that ansible has finished speaking.

msg.description: The text to be spoken.  Use either msg or msg_file.  Optional so that you can use this module just to play sounds.

voice.description: Which voice to use. See notes for how to discover installed voices.  If the requested voice is not available the default voice will be used. Example voice names from Windows 10 are 'Microsoft Zira Desktop' and 'Microsoft Hazel Desktop'.

speech_speed.description: How fast or slow to speak the text.  Must be an integer value in the range -10 to 10.  -10 is slowest, 10 is fastest.
